noun.description: People of royal blood or status.
examples: diplomats, heads of state, and royalty shared tables at the banquet

noun.description: A sum of money paid to a patentee for the use of a patent or to an author or composer for each copy of a book sold or for each public performance of a work.
A royal right (now especially over minerals) granted by the sovereign to an individual or corporation.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French roialte, from roial (see royal). The sense royal right (especially over minerals) (late 15th century) developed into the sense payment made by a mineral producer to the site owner (mid 19th century), which was then transferred to payments for the use of patents and published materials.
